FuncDef:
The evpn mpls routing-enable command enables EVPN to generate and advertise IP prefix routes and IRB routes.
The undo evpn mpls routing-enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, EVPN is not enabled to generate and advertise IP prefix routes or IRB routes.
ParentView: VPN instance IPv4 address family view
VPN instance IPv6 address family view
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In an EVPN L3VPN scenario, if MPLS or SR-MPLS tunnels are used as public network tunnels (including splicing scenarios), run the evpn mpls routing-enable command to enable EVPN to generate and advertise IP prefix routes and IRB routes so that the local device can advertise IP prefix routes and IRB routes to EVPN peers. If non-MPLS tunnels such as VXLAN and SRv6 tunnels are used on the public network, you do not need to run this command.
